lecture.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a long talk on a particular subject that someone gives to a group of people, especially to students in a university
lecture.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: He regularly gives lectures on modern French literature.
lecture.translation[0].definitions[1].de: an act of criticizing someone or warning them about something in a long serious talk, in a way that they think is unfair or unnecessary
lecture.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: My father caught me and gave me a long lecture about the dangers of drink.
lecture.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: She gave a fascinating lecture on crime in the 1800s.

lecture.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to talk angrily or seriously to someone in order to criticize or warn them, in a way that they think is unfair or unnecessary
lecture.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: I wish you’d stop lecturing me!
He began to lecture us about making too much noise.
